moments.title: Vision: Singing for Mental Health & Wellness Meetup

core_quotes.speaker: Gio
core_quotes.text: Singing for mental health and wellness - an interactive experience designed to help neurodiverse participants through soothing vocal exercises, Dalcroze-inspired movement, building skills in self-soothing, mindfulness, and body awareness in a supportive group setting.

core_quotes.speaker: Gio
core_quotes.text: I really do believe that singing is a way to... that it really does something for your well-being.

core_quotes.speaker: Gio
core_quotes.text: What would I want to foster? A special community interested in singing together.

reactions.speaker: Melissa Reskof
reactions.quote: Is this still calling to you? When you put it on paper... I'm combining all of these things that really sing my song. Would honing it still work for you?

reactions.speaker: Doug Snyder
reactions.quote: This is what I'm doing, who wants to come along? Be clear what you need and what you want... The more clarity you have, it helps people self-select.

reactions.speaker: Lizzy Summers
reactions.quote: Just amazing. I love it. I think your avenue is brilliant. To have a group where you can open your mouth and make sounds and not be judged by whatever sound comes out, what a gift! You have a lovely presence to lead something like that.

reactions.speaker: Gregory Cowley
reactions.quote: You'll probably find there's a lot of people who feel the same way... You can start with friends, small group, people on your email. It doesn't have to be formal.

reactions.speaker: Rishi Badlani
reactions.quote: You won't be able to make everybody happy. Gotta do what you want to do... easier said than done to someone with ADHD, but just do it.

reactions.speaker: Stara Shakti
reactions.quote: Imagine the kind of people you want to come... What problems do you solve for them? I'm starting a Goddess Chant Song Circle... specificity draws specific people.

ripple_effects.speaker: Stara Shakti
ripple_effects.description: Shared her own parallel experience starting a Goddess Chant Song Circle
ripple_effects.quote: I'm starting a Goddess Chant Song Circle, and it's for women who love the Divine Feminine... it draws a specific type of person.

ripple_effects.speaker: Melissa Reskof
ripple_effects.description: Connected to her own experience as a singer
ripple_effects.quote: I'm an alto, I haven't really sung since college... I really liked the singing together in a group. There was some connection that you couldn't name, but it had a vibe.

speaker_evolution.started_with: Year-old idea combining self-hypnosis, Dalcroze movement, and vocal exercises - feeling stuck on how to start
speaker_evolution.ended_with: Clarity to start informally with people she knows, honing down to core: singing together for well-being
speaker_evolution.catalyst: Multiple perspectives: Doug's 'who wants to come along?' framing, Gregory's 'start informal' advice, Rishi's 'just do it'

themes.name: Clarity Before Action
themes.description: The importance of getting clear on what you really want before trying to attract others - 'this is what I'm doing, who wants to come along?'

themes.name: Start Small and Informal
themes.description: Resistance to formal launch can be overcome by starting with friends, small groups, low stakes

themes.name: Singing as Somatic Healing
themes.description: Voice work as a path to well-being and nervous system regulation
